nurse.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: someone whose job is to look after people who are ill or injured, usually in a hospital
nurse.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: The nurse is coming to give you an injection.
The school nurse sent Sara home.
a student nurse  (=someone who is learning to be a nurse)
a psychiatric nurse  (=a nurse for people who are mentally ill)
nurse.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: a woman employed to look after a young child
nurse.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to look after someone who is ill or injured
nurse.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: He’s been nursing an elderly relative.
After Ray’s operation, Mrs Stallard nursed him back to health.
nurse.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: She spent several years nursing in a military hospital.
nurse.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: to rest when you have an illness or injury so that it will get better
nurse.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: Shaw has been nursing an injury, and will not play on Sunday.
nurse.translation[1].definitions[2].note: Nurse is never passive in this meaning
nurse.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: if a woman nurses a baby, she feeds it with milk from her breasts
nurse.translation[1].definitions[3].exam: information on nutrition for nursing mothers
nurse.translation[1].definitions[4].defi: if a baby nurses, it sucks milk from its mother’s breast
nurse.translation[1].definitions[5].defi: to keep a feeling or idea in your mind for a long time, especially an angry feeling
nurse.translation[1].definitions[5].exam: For years he had nursed a grievance against his former employer.
nurse.translation[1].definitions[5].note: Nurse is never passive in this meaning
nurse.translation[1].definitions[6].defi: to take special care of something, especially during a difficult situation
nurse.translation[1].definitions[6].exam: He bought the hotel in 1927 and managed to nurse it through the Depression.
nurse.translation[1].definitions[7].defi: if you nurse a drink, especially an alcoholic one, you drink it very slowly
nurse.translation[1].definitions[7].exam: Oliver sat at the bar, nursing a bottle of beer.
nurse.translation[1].definitions[8].defi: to hold something carefully in your hands or arms close to your body
